title: Crimes in the Wild
description: True crime mysteries can be dark and thrilling. But what if humans can't crack the case? What if the suspect ... isn't human? This hour, TED Radio Hour investigates crimes with a wild twist. Guests include forensic scientist Lauren Pharr Parks, author Mary Roach, dog trainer and conservationist Megan Parker, wildlife intelligence analyst Sarah Stoner.

itunes:title: Crimes in the Wild
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: This hour, TED speakers share stories of animals who help solve, perpetrate, or are victims of various crimes.
itunes:subtitle: This hour, TED speakers share stories of animals who help solve, perpetrate, or are victims of various crimes.
